description: The ORDER_RES table contains result finding information for an order. Result findings include mammography pathology results, cardiovascular palette findings, and other result findings.

columns.name: FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier of the finding record corresponding to the result.

columns.name: RESULT_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The result type category ID for the order result.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries:

Joint Exam

columns.name: RECOMMENDATION_C_NAME
columns.description:
The mammography recommendation category number for the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Short Interval Follow-up


Ultrasound


Biopsy

columns.name: RECO_SIDE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The side of the body category ID for which side a mammography recommendation is for. Maps to Right, Left, or Bilateral.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Bilateral


Right


Left

columns.name: CLASS_OF_LESION_C_NAME
columns.description:
The classification of lesion category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Benign


High Risk


Malignant


Premalignancy - Hyperplasia


Malignant - Non-lung


Clinical - without histology


Non-diagnostic


Other (please specify)


Unknown

columns.name: SIZE_OF_TUMOR
columns.description: The size of the tumor (mm) for pathology results of mammogram biopsies.

columns.name: PATH_FND_SIDE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The finding side category ID for the pathology result.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: FINDING_SIDE_C_NAME

columns.name: HISTOLOGY_GRADE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The histology grade category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


GX


G1


G2


G3


DCIS: Low Grade


DCIS: Intermediate Grade


DCIS: High Grade

columns.name: MARGIN_STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The margin status category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Uninvolved


Involved

columns.name: NIPPLE_INVOLVED_YN_NAME
columns.description:
Indicates if nipple is included in the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes

columns.name: NODES_REMOVED
columns.description: The number of nodes removed.

columns.name: NODES_POSITIVE
columns.description: The number of nodes positive in the pathology result.

columns.name: STAGE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The cancer staging category number for the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Stage 0


Stage 1


Stage 2A


Stage 2B


Stage 3A


Stage 3B


Stage 3C


Stage 4


Stage 1A


Stage 1B

columns.name: ESTROGEN_RECP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The estrogen receptor category ID for the estrogen receptor associated with the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Negative


Positive

columns.name: PROGESTERONE_RCP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The estrogen receptor category ID that clarifies the progesterone receptor in the pathology result.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ESTROGEN_RECP_C_NAME

columns.name: S_PHASE
columns.description: The S phase for a specific pathology result.

columns.name: OB_ULTRASOUND_GA
columns.description: The gestational age interpreted for the entire ultrasound, in days, for the result corresponding to ultrasound findings.

columns.name: NEEDS_FOLLOW_UP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The needs follow up category number for the order results. This is used as a flag for a recommendation record that needs follow up.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Needs Follow-up


Closed


Resolved

columns.name: MAMMO_DUE_DT
columns.description: Due date for the recommendation.

columns.name: MAMMO_FIND_CTX_C_NAME
columns.description:
The context category number for the mammography finding. This is populated using the enhanced drawing tools to document on breast diagrams within the radiology mammography module. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Technologist


Radiologist

columns.name: ORIGINAL_FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the original finding this finding record was copied from.

columns.name: GRAFT_ID
columns.description: The raft ID for this result.

columns.name: DOMINANCE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The coronary dominance category ID for the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Left


Right


Co-dominant

columns.name: ANNOTATION_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The annotation type category ID for the coronary diagram annotation result finding.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Lesion


Existing Stent


Graft


Collateral


Branch

columns.name: ANNOT_VESSEL_ID
columns.description: The major vessel of the annotation.

columns.name: ANNOT_VESSEL_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: ANNOT_SEGM_ID
columns.description: The vessel segment ID.

columns.name: ANNOT_SEGM_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: ANNOT_END_SEGM_ID
columns.description: The ending vessel segment ID.

columns.name: ANNOT_END_SEGM_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: COLLAT_END_VES_ID
columns.description: The major vessel ID of the destination of a collateral

columns.name: COLLAT_END_VES_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: COLLAT_END_SEGM_ID
columns.description: The vessel segment of the destination of a collateral.

columns.name: COLLAT_END_SEGM_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.description:
The vessel location category ID for the result record.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: SEGMENT_LOC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The location of the body category ID for an annotation of a segment. Used to distinguish between two separate annotations in the same segment. Maps to proximal and distal.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


PROXIMAL


DISTAL

columns.name: LESION_PRE_STEN
columns.description: The pre-stent stenosis percentage for this result.

columns.name: LESION_POST_STEN
columns.description: The post-stent stenosis percentage for this result.

columns.name: INTERVENTION_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The intervention type category ID of the intervention.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Angioplasty


Stent


Atherectomy


Thrombolysis


PCI


Valvuloplasty


PFO Closure


ASD Closure


VSD Closure


Peripheral Intervention


Foreign Body Removal - Percutaneous


Post-Intervention Lesion Assessment


Thrombectomy

columns.name: ATMOS_INFLATION
columns.description: The measures of the balloon atmospheres inflation for the result.

columns.name: SEC_OF_INFLATION
columns.description: The number of seconds of balloon inflation measured for the result.

columns.name: STENT_LENGTH
columns.description: Indicates length of the stent

columns.name: STENT_DIAMETER
columns.description: Indicates diameter of the stent.

columns.name: INTERVENTIO_SEQ_NUM
columns.description: The sequence of the intervention.

columns.name: GRAFT_PROX_ANAST_ID
columns.description: The proximal anastomosis for a graft.

columns.name: GRAFT_PROX_ANAST_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: GR_DIST_ANST_VEL_ID
columns.description: The major vessel of the distal anastomosis for a graft.

columns.name: GR_DIST_ANST_VEL_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: GR_DIST_ANST_SEG_ID
columns.description: The vessel segment of the distal anastomosis for a graft.

columns.name: GR_DIST_ANST_SEG_ID_RECORD_NAME
columns.description: Stores record name (.2)

columns.name: GRAFT_SEQ_NUM
columns.description: The graft sequence number in a multi-vessel graft.

columns.name: CONDITION_C_NAME
columns.description:
The patient condition category ID for the result finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Resting


Stress


Post Stress


Baseline


Low Dose


Mid Dose


Peak Dose


Metabolic


Rest Attenuation Correction


Stress Attenuation Correction

columns.name: TECH_DOC_DTTM
columns.description: The instant at which this finding was documented in the procedure log.

columns.name: MAMMO_FIND_PULFW_YN
columns.description:
Indicates, at the finding level, whether or not a Mammo finding in Image Documentation should be pulled forward to future studies.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NIPPLE_INVOLVED_YN_NAME

columns.name: PAT_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the patient record with whom the result finding as associated. This column is frequently used to link to the PATIENT table.

columns.name: MAMFND_SRC_FIND_ID
columns.description: The result finding unique identifier for the source result finding from which the current result finding record was copied. Typically populated for permanent findings such as scars or tattoos.

columns.name: MAMMO_BIOPSY_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The mammography biopsy type category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Excisional biopsy


Core biopsy


Fine needle aspiration cytology


Cyst aspiration - diagnostic


Incisional Biopsy


Other


Biopsy performed, type unknown

columns.name: MAMFND_PFWD_VERF_YN
columns.description:
Indicates if a finding was verified in the Mammo Image Documentation section.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: NIPPLE_INVOLVED_YN_NAME

columns.name: PAT_CSN
columns.description: The unique contact serial number (CSN) of the patient for whom the contact was moved.

columns.name: LAST_FINDING_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the most recent finding for a breast lesion. Use this column to join to another copy of ORDER_RES on the FINDING_ID column. This will only be populated for lesion records in ORDER_RES where RESULT_TYPE_C is equal to 52013 (Lesion).

columns.name: LAST_LSN_STAT_C
columns.description:
The mammography last lesion status for the lesion.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Active


Deleted


Resolved

columns.name: CONF_OF_TARGET_C_NAME
columns.description:
The confirmation of target category ID for a breast biopsy lesion that indicates whether or not the suspicious lesion was obtained.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: IMG_DEVICE_USED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The imaging device used category ID for the finding of a breast biopsy.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: TECHNIQUE_USED_C_NAME
columns.description:
The technique used category ID for a breast biopsy.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 No Entries Defined

columns.name: BIOPSY_REPEAT_TYP_C_NAME
columns.description:
The category number of the type of biopsy that was performed for a repeat procedure.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: MAMMO_BIOPSY_TYPE_C_NAME

columns.name: MYOCARDIAL_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:

columns.name: PATH_RESULT_DATE
columns.description: The date on which a pathology result was returned from the lab after a breast biopsy was performed.

columns.name: INVASIVE_SIZE_MM
columns.description: The size (mm) of the invasive component of a breast lesion.

columns.name: IN_SITU_SIZE_MM
columns.description: The size (mm) of the in situ component of a breast legion.

columns.name: NUM_OF_MARGINS
columns.description: The number of margins that were identified anatomically and measured in metric units for a breast lesion.

columns.name: SPEC_COMP_SUBMTD_YN
columns.description:
Indicates whether the specimen was completely submitted (totally embedded) for microscopic evaluation following a surgical breast procedure.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


No


Yes


Unknown

columns.name: MAM_SURGERY_TYPE_C_NAME
columns.description:
The surgery type category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries:

Mastectomy


Re-Excision

columns.name: LN_EXTRA_EXTNSN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The extracapsular extension status category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


Absent


Present

columns.name: HER2_IHC_C_NAME
columns.description:
The HER2/neu IHC category ID for the pathology result.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries: 


0 


1+


2+


3+

columns.name: HER2_FISH_C_NAME
columns.description:
The HER2/neu FISH category ID for the pathology result.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: ESTROGEN_RECP_C_NAME

columns.name: STATUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
The lab status category ID for a follow-up recommendation.


May contain organization-specific values: No


 Category Entries:

Open

The general recommendation category ID for the follow-up recommendation of a non-mammography study.

 Category Entries:

The anatomical region category ID for the follow-up recommendation of a non-mammography study.

The modality type category ID for the follow-up recommendation of a non-mammography study.

columns.name: GEN_RECOM_DUE_IN_C_NAME
columns.description:
The general recommendation due within category ID due date that defines the recommended time frame for the follow-up recommendation of a non-mammography study.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: GEN_RECOM_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The comment entered for a follow-up recommendation for a non-mammography study.

columns.name: REC_SRC_FINDING_ID
columns.description: The finding record ID associated with a follow-up recommendation placed on a study.

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_ACTY_C_NAME
columns.description:
The acuity level category ID for the finding.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Critical


Significant


Unexpected

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_FINDING_C_NAME
columns.description:
The acuity notification findings category ID for the critical result.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_BGN_USR_ID
columns.description: The user who documented a critical result.

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_BEGIN_DTTM
columns.description: The instant at which a critical result was documented on a study.

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_END_USR_ID
columns.description: The user who completed the follow-up communication on a critical result.

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_END_DTTM
columns.description: The instant at which a critical result follow-up communication was completed on a study.

columns.name: PATH_LAB_ORDER_ID
columns.description: The lab order that the pathology finding is documenting.

columns.name: PATH_DOCUMENT_ID
columns.description: The scanned document that the pathology finding is linked to.

columns.name: PATH_BIOPSY_DATE
columns.description: The biopsy date for the tissue sample that the pathology finding corresponds to.  This column will not include pre-upgrade data until after a specific workflow is done (ORD conversion 248404 has run to completion). If you are unsure whether this has happened yet, you can get the entire set of data if you COALESCE this column with the old column for the pathology biopsy date (ORDER_PROC_2.PATH_RSLT_DATE).

columns.name: PATH_NOTE_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the user-entered, free-form text note that stores the comment/narrative text for the pathology finding as rich text format data. This column will not include pre-upgrade data until after a specific workflow is done (ORD conversion 248404 run to completion). If you are unsure whether this has happened yet, you can get the entire set of data if you COALESCE this column with the old column for pathology comment/narrative text (ORDER_PROC_4.PATH_NARR_NOTE_ID).

columns.name: RSLT_TRK_FND_COMMNT
columns.description: The comment associated with a critical result finding.

columns.name: RESULT_NAME
columns.description: Stores the result name.
